Choose a profile and configurate your personal settings for the app UI
The large text setting increases the text size.
Fontface allows you to choose a font style you prefer.
Increases the contrast and makes the text on bricks easier to read.
Adds icons to categories and bricks to improve recognizability.
Changes the brick icons to high contrast icons.
The large element spacing increase the space between touchable elements.
Shows only starter bricks for ease of learning.
Adds delay to the drag\'n\'drop of bricks.
Visual improvement: High contrast, additional icons
Visual improvement: Large text, large icons, large element spacing, high contrast
Input improvement: Large element spacing, drag\'n\'drop delay

WARNING:\nThis seems to be a private program. Converting it may fail!

Version 2.0, 20 September 2017


To offer you all collaborative benefits of our services and the associated account, it is necessary to collect certain data from you.


• To use your account in our systems, and to inform you about necessary changes about your account (e.g., updates/violation of our Use of Terms of Use and Service or of community rules) or our policies, we will store your username and, if provided by you, your E-Mail address. If you’ve connected your account via Google Plus or Facebook, we additionally store an identification key connected to your account on these services. We will not use this data for any other (e.g., marketing) purposes, unless you explicitly allowed us to do so.


• To avoid misuse of our services (e.g., through user contributed uploads or comments) for illegal purposes, the user generated public data will be stored internally in a database, together with a timestamp and the used IP address.


• To improve our services (apps and websites) and to do scientific research on ICT and STEM education, we use Google Analytics, Crashlytics and Firebase by Google Inc. to get metadata about the usage (e.g., timestamps, visited pages/screens, used operating system, and information about the network provider). This analysis and the collected data is not linked to your profile and does not contain any personal information.


• On a voluntary basis, you can give us your country of residence through your account page on the sharing site. This will only be used for statistical and research purposes by us and can be removed at any time in your profile settings.


• You can withdraw the usage of this data at any time by deleting your account through your profile page on https://share.catrob.at/. After deleting your account you will still be able to use the provided services, but not to collaborate, e.g., through uploading programs, commenting or liking. Also all provided content linked to your account, e.g. uploaded programs, comments, will get deleted.


• All Services are provided by the non-profit free open source Catrobat project under the umbrella of the International Catrobat Association – Verein zur Förderung freier Software (Graz, Austria).


• To get in touch with us, please send an E-Mail to contact@catrobat.org or mail us to Catrobat,
 c/o
 Institute of Software Technology,
 Inffeldgasse 16b/II,
 8010 Graz, Austria.


In case you are below the age of 16, this policy must be accepted by a legal guardian (usually parents).

It is necessary to agree the Privacy Policy to register or to further use your account. If you do not want that this data gets collected you can delete your existing account via the profile page on our web interface and still use all services of this app that do not need an account.
Warunki użytkowania i korzystania z usługi

Aby móc korzystać z Pocket Code i innych plików wykonywalnych, oferowanych w ramach projektu Catrobat, musisz zgodzić się na nasze warunki użytkowania i korzystania z usługi oraz ściśle ich przestrzegać, gdy korzystasz z Pocket Code i innych naszych plików wykonywalnych. Link poniżej prowadzi do ich precyzyjnego sformułowania. \n
Warunki użytkowania i korzystania z usługi
Warunki użytkowania i korzystania z usługi
You attempt to use this app together with Parrot\'s AR.Drone 2.0. We strongly remind you to abide to Parrot\'s Terms of Use and Services for the drone and to Catrobat\'s Terms of Use and Services.
You attempt to use Pocket Code together with Parrot\'s Jumping Sumo. We strongly remind you to abide to Parrot\'s terms of use for the drone and to Catrobat\'s terms of use for Pocket Code.

This app offers a programming environment and interpreter for the visual programming language Catrobat.

 The source code of this app is mainly licensed under the GNU AGPL v3 License. For further details on the license see the link below.

Aby działać, Pocket Code potrzebuje zewnętrznej pamięci do zapisu, np. karty SD, ale nie została ona znaleziona.\nMożesz rozwiązać ten problem poprzez zapis w zewnętrznej pamięci lub włożyć kartę SD i spróbować ponownie.

The formula editor allows you to create mathematical and logical formulas that you can use in your bricks.\n\nYou can advance this little intro by touching the \"Next\" button in the bottom right corner, and you can skip it by touching the \"SKIP\" button in the bottom left corner.
Tutaj możesz zobaczyć swoją formułę, a także ją edytować.
Similar to a calculator, this is where you can create your formula.
To test your formula and display its current result, you can use \"Compute\".
This is a collection of values that describe your current object. Some of these values are for example the x- and y-coordinates, or the current speed.

Like a calculator, the formula editor offers a multitude of mathematical functions.\nYou can find trigonometric functions such as \"sin\" and \"cos\", but also a random number generator or text and list functions.

Logic is used to compare values and combine logical formulas.\nTo compare values you can use logical operations such as \">\" (greater than) or \"=\" (equals).\nTo combine logical formulas you can use logical operations such as \"AND\", \"OR\" and \"NOT\".
In \"Device\" you can find information that your smartphone or tablet records.\nFor example, the tilt of your device, or the loudness of your surroundings.
Variables and lists that are used in your program can be found here.\nYou can simply insert these in your formula, or add new ones.
Dodawanie Bloku użytkownika do Bloku użytkownika nie jest jeszcze możliwe!
Bieżąca scena i wybrana scena są takie same!
Caution! Different resolutions detected. %1$s has resolution %2$d×%3$d and %4$s has resolution %5$d×%6$d. Using resolution of %1$s.
Zmienna %1$s jest używana w obu programach. Jeśli programy używają tej samej nazwy zmiennej nie można ich scalić. Proszę zmienić nazwę zmiennej w jednym z programów i spróbuj ponownie.
Lista %1$s jest używana w obu programach. Jeśli programy używają tej samej nazwy listy nie można ich scalić. Proszę zmienić nazwę listy w jednym z programów i spróbuj ponownie.

Projekt używa bloczków Cast i nie można go uruchomić lokalnie

.\nNie widać twojego urządzenia? Spróbuj wyłączyć i włączyć WiFi w telefonie.
Jeśli lubisz tę aplikację, oceń nas w Google Play!
Usunięcie zmiennej, która jest używana jest niebezpieczne! Na pewno usunąć?
Your program gets uploaded to the app’s sharing site where others can use and download it. You can also download your program as a standalone app.
Wszystkie klocki są podzielone na kategorie. Wybierz kategorię, której szukasz.
Aby dodać bloczek do skryptu, naciśnij bloczek, który chcesz użyć.
Short tap on a brick opens the menu to move, copy, delete, or add a brick to the backpack. The help option will show you additional information. Drag and drop the brick with a long press.
Skrypt zdefiniuje zachowanie Twojego obiektu. Aby dodać bloczek do skryptu naciśnij symbol \"+\".
Tutaj możesz znaleźć różne typy wyglądu danego obiektu. Aby dodać nowy wygląd naciśnij symbol \"+\".
Tutaj możesz dodać nowe dźwięki do obiektu. Należy pamiętać, aby używać bloczku z kategorii dźwięku.
Program składa się z różnych obiektów, które mogą oddziaływać na siebie nawzajem. Aby dodać nowy obiekt naciśnij symbol \"+\".
To merge two programs, long press on one program to open the menu and tap on \'Merge with\'.
Hit the back-button to pause your program. To show axes and the screen size of your device, tap \"Axes on\".
A program can consist of different independent scenes. To add a new scene, tap on the \"+\" symbol.
Change the listed settings as you wish or switch to predefined profiles to choose a god to help you with these settings.
Choose a guide to help you with Create@School. Which one fits to you?
Choose one of the predefined templates and modify it.
Pomóż poprawić Pocket Code wysyłając anonimowe raporty o awariach!

Create awesome games and other projects to win fantastic prizes! The grand prize is an invitation to the Google headquarters in California together with a parent, with tons of other goodies and giveaways from Google and Catrobat for participants!
Please use the Create@School username and password that you have received from your school. As a school, please register on %1$s to receive complimentary accounts for your teachers and students.
When tapped: play sound, increase score, switch look, place somewhere else
When tapped: play sound, reduce score, get bigger, place somewhere else

Hands on - control by using inclination
If inclination_y is greater than (>) 50 set motor B+C to -50%% (backward) speed.
If inclination_y is smaller than (<) - 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_y\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 50%% speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 50 %%.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set the left motor to speed 50 %%.

ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' and \'inclination_y\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the values. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). Combine both terms with AND
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.
ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 20%% speed.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 20 %%.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the left motor to speed 20 %%.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.

ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_ultrasonic\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t remove the second part (AND move = TRUE).
ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'EV3 Lego\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards for 5 seconds.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'EV3 Lego\'. The robot should turn to the right gorgeous 5 seconds.
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE.
Extra task - create a maze ultrasonic sensor
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'infrated\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Keep the second part (AND move = true)
ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'Lego EV3\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards for 5 seconds.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'Lego EV3\'. The robot should turn to the right fir 5 seconds.
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'EV3_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.
Hands on - control by using inclination
If inclination_y is greater than (>) 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed.
If inclination_y is smaller than (<) - 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_y\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 20%% speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
